intro: Linaria gharbensis var. mekinensis, commonly known as the Mekin's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its stems are usually hairy and branched. It is often found in high-altitude habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
